inventory.name: Chain Mail
inventory.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows.

inventory.name: Longsword
inventory.description: A versatile weapon that can be used with one or two hands.

inventory.name: Shield
inventory.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand.

mythic_events.name: The Lost City
mythic_events.description: An entire city vanished under unknown circumstances, leaving myths and ruins.

artifact_lore.name: Horn of the Lost City
artifact_lore.creation_story: The only remaining artifact from a city that vanished in a single night. When blown, some claim to hear echoes of the lost city's final moments.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A haunting reminder of hubris and the fragility of civilization. Scholars study it seeking clues to the city's fate.
legendary_properties: When blown, creates a thunderous sound audible for miles
Once per day, can cast Sending to contact someone in the lost city (may reach the dead)
Reveals illusions and hidden passages within 60 feet when sounded
Bearer has advantage on History checks about lost civilizations
artifact_lore.location_hint: Found in the ruins where the lost city once stood, guarded by restless spirits

mythic_events.name: The Sun-Eater
mythic_events.description: An eclipse coincided with strange events and birthed fearsome tales.

artifact_lore.name: Cloak of the Sun-Eater
artifact_lore.creation_story: Woven from threads that captured the darkness during the great eclipse. Those who wore it during that fateful day were said to see visions of things that had not yet come to pass.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Feared and revered as an artifact of prophecy and doom. Many disasters were predicted by those who wore this cloak.
legendary_properties: Grants advantage on Stealth checks in dim light or darkness
Once per day, can cast Darkness
Wearer has darkvision to 120 feet
Once per week, can attempt to see a vision of the near future (DM discretion)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Hidden away by fearful priests in a sealed chamber beneath an ancient temple

mythic_events.name: The Quiet Plague
mythic_events.description: A sickness passed through generations and reshaped population centers.

artifact_lore.name: Chalice of the Quiet Plague
artifact_lore.creation_story: Fashioned by healers during the Quiet Plague in a desperate attempt to understand the sickness. Those who drank from it could sense disease, though many died in the attempt.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A grim reminder of past suffering, but also of the courage of healers. Medical traditions still reference the sacrifices made during the plague.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Detect Poison and Disease at will
Advantage on Medicine checks
Once per day, can remove one disease from a touched creature
Immune to disease (but can still carry and transmit)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Sealed in a quarantine vault in the ruins of a plague hospital

mythic_events.name: The Quiet Plague
mythic_events.description: A sickness passed through generations and reshaped population centers.

artifact_lore.name: Chalice of the Quiet Plague
artifact_lore.creation_story: Fashioned by healers during the Quiet Plague in a desperate attempt to understand the sickness. Those who drank from it could sense disease, though many died in the attempt.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A grim reminder of past suffering, but also of the courage of healers. Medical traditions still reference the sacrifices made during the plague.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Detect Poison and Disease at will
Advantage on Medicine checks
Once per day, can remove one disease from a touched creature
Immune to disease (but can still carry and transmit)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Sealed in a quarantine vault in the ruins of a plague hospital

mythic_events.name: The Wanderer's Star
mythic_events.description: A comet appeared and was taken as an omen that altered faiths.

artifact_lore.name: Staff of the Wandering Star
artifact_lore.creation_story: Carved from wood that fell from the sky during the great comet's passing, this staff is inscribed with celestial charts that shift to show future alignments.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Sacred to astronomers, prophets, and those who seek to read fate in the stars. Many faiths were reformed based on visions seen through this staff.
legendary_properties: +2 magical weapon
Once per day, can cast Divination without material components
Grants advantage on Arcana and Nature checks related to celestial phenomena
In moonlight, reveals hidden paths and secret doors within 30 feet
artifact_lore.location_hint: Last seen in the observatory of a lost city, abandoned centuries ago

mythic_events.name: The Stone Pact
mythic_events.description: Rival tribes sealed a covenant at the Stone Circle and formed lasting alliances.

artifact_lore.name: Ring of the Stone Pact
artifact_lore.creation_story: Forged from the melted weapons of twelve warring tribes who swore peace at the Stone Circle. Each band of the ring bears one tribe's sigil, eternally intertwined.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of diplomacy, alliance, and the power of keeping one's word. Many treaties are still sworn upon this ring's memory.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Zone of Truth once per day
Advantage on Persuasion checks when negotiating peace or treaties
Can understand all spoken languages
When making a promise while wearing the ring, both parties know if the promise is sincere
artifact_lore.location_hint: Kept in the vault of a neutral sanctuary where the original pact was signed

mythic_events.name: The Wanderer's Star
mythic_events.description: A comet appeared and was taken as an omen that altered faiths.

artifact_lore.name: Staff of the Wandering Star
artifact_lore.creation_story: Carved from wood that fell from the sky during the great comet's passing, this staff is inscribed with celestial charts that shift to show future alignments.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Sacred to astronomers, prophets, and those who seek to read fate in the stars. Many faiths were reformed based on visions seen through this staff.

In moonlight, reveals hidden paths and secret doors within 30 feet
artifact_lore.location_hint: Last seen in the observatory of a lost city, abandoned centuries ago

artifact_lore.name: Horn of the Lost City

mythic_events.name: The Quiet Plague
mythic_events.description: A sickness passed through generations and reshaped population centers.

artifact_lore.name: Chalice of the Quiet Plague
artifact_lore.creation_story: Fashioned by healers during the Quiet Plague in a desperate attempt to understand the sickness. Those who drank from it could sense disease, though many died in the attempt.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A grim reminder of past suffering, but also of the courage of healers. Medical traditions still reference the sacrifices made during the plague.

Advantage on Medicine checks

mythic_events.name: The Oath of Twelve
mythic_events.description: Twelve leaders swore an oath at the mountain pass, creating an order that endures in legend.

artifact_lore.name: Gauntlets of the Twelve Oaths
artifact_lore.creation_story: When the Twelve swore their legendary oath at the mountain pass, each pressed their hand into molten steel. These gauntlets bear the handprints of those ancient heroes.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of honor, duty, and brotherhood. Many knightly orders trace their traditions back to the Oath of Twelve.
legendary_properties: +2 to Strength-based attack and damage rolls
Unarmed strikes deal 1d8 + Strength modifier damage
Once per day, can call upon oath to gain advantage on all attacks for 1 minute
Cannot be disarmed while wearing these gauntlets
artifact_lore.location_hint: Buried with one of the Twelve in a hidden tomb at the mountain pass

historical_figures.name: Kellen Silvermane
historical_figures.title: Oathkeeper
achievements: Attempted to prevent The Lost City
historical_figures.backstory: Trained from youth in the art of war, Kellen Silvermane Oathkeeper defended the realm against countless threats. They were central to the foundational events that defined the age.

historical_figures.name: Bruni Steelbeard
historical_figures.title: the Valiant
achievements: Attempted to prevent The Lost City
historical_figures.backstory: Master of political intrigue, Bruni Steelbeard the Valiant orchestrated alliances that changed history. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Kava Myastan
historical_figures.title: the Terrible
historical_figures.backstory: Kava Myastan the Terrible claimed the throne by force, plunging the realm into civil war. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Vistra Gemcutter
historical_figures.title: the Just
historical_figures.backstory: Known for cruelty and ambition, Vistra Gemcutter the Just brought entire kingdoms under tyrannical rule. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Thranduil Silverleaf
historical_figures.title: the Magnificent
historical_figures.backstory: Thranduil Silverleaf the Magnificent founded a fanatical movement that spread terror in the name of twisted faith. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Nimrodel Sunshadow
historical_figures.title: the Ancient
achievements: Saved countless lives during The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Nimrodel Sunshadow the Ancient turned enemies into allies and defeats into victories through brilliant strategy. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Sera Amastacia
historical_figures.title: the Great
achievements: Saved countless lives during The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Blessed with divine insight, Sera Amastacia the Great guided civilization through apocalyptic trials. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Gwendolyn Brightblade
historical_figures.title: the Terrible
achievements: Saved countless lives during The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Through unparalleled skill and innovation, Gwendolyn Brightblade the Terrible crafted artifacts of immense power. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Arwen Moonwhisper
historical_figures.title: the Cunning
achievements: Saved countless lives during The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Arwen Moonwhisper the Cunning ruled with wisdom and compassion, creating an age of peace and growth. They were central to the foundational events that defined the age.

historical_figures.name: Elara Brightblade
historical_figures.title: the Just
historical_figures.backstory: Known for profound wisdom and foresight, Elara Brightblade the Just shaped the fate of nations through advice. They were central to the foundational events that defined the age.

historical_figures.name: Rhogar Shestendeliath
historical_figures.title: Oathkeeper
historical_figures.backstory: Known for profound wisdom and foresight, Rhogar Shestendeliath Oathkeeper shaped the fate of nations through advice. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Leoric Brightblade
historical_figures.title: Stormbreaker
achievements: Betrayed the peace of The Stone Pact
historical_figures.backstory: Murdering rightful heirs, Leoric Brightblade Stormbreaker established a reign of terror and paranoia. Their actions during the great events are still remembered in song and story.

historical_figures.name: Celeste Blackwood
historical_figures.title: Dragonslayer
achievements: Negotiated the historic accord of The Stone Pact
historical_figures.backstory: Celeste Blackwood Dragonslayer spoke truths that others feared to hear, shaping spiritual understanding. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Bruni Deepmine
historical_figures.title: the Mighty
historical_figures.backstory: Bruni Deepmine the Mighty traveled the lands sharing visions and warnings that would prove prophetic. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Elrohir Forestwarden
historical_figures.title: Kingmaker
achievements: Attempted to prevent The Lost City
historical_figures.backstory: Elrohir Forestwarden Kingmaker achieved victory through clever tactics and diplomatic maneuvering rather than force. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Finrod Moonwhisper
historical_figures.title: the Magnificent
achievements: Attempted to prevent The Lost City
historical_figures.backstory: Known for profound wisdom and foresight, Finrod Moonwhisper the Magnificent shaped the fate of nations through advice. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

historical_figures.name: Pearl Took
historical_figures.title: the Magnificent
achievements: Saved countless lives during The Quiet Plague
historical_figures.backstory: Known for profound wisdom and foresight, Pearl Took the Magnificent shaped the fate of nations through advice. Their role in the legendary events shaped the course of civilization.

civilizations.name: Clan Oathkeeper
civilizations.cultural_description: Clan Oathkeeper is a dwarf civilization united confederation of clans. Their culture is defined by prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth, deeply honor-bound traditions, legendary craftsmanship.

territory.territorial_description: Clan Oathkeeper controls a modest territory of 5 regions centered on their capital in the Alpine Mountains.

notable_features: Master smiths and miners without equal

civilizations.name: Free City of Haven
civilizations.cultural_description: Free City of Haven is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization governed by elected councils. Their culture is defined by strict laws and social order, pursuit of knowledge and wisdom, prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth.

territory.territorial_description: Free City of Haven controls a substantial territory of 9 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Melting pot of cultures and traditions
Complex legal systems balancing diverse needs

civilizations.name: The Sanctuary Alliance
civilizations.cultural_description: The Sanctuary Alliance is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization governed by elected councils. Their culture is defined by prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth, pursuit of knowledge and wisdom, fierce independence and personal liberty.

territory.territorial_description: The Sanctuary Alliance controls a substantial territory of 8 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Melting pot of cultures and traditions

civilizations.name: The Gateway Alliance
civilizations.cultural_description: The Gateway Alliance is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization governed by elected councils. Their culture is defined by fierce independence and personal liberty, strict laws and social order, spirit of innovation and progress.

territory.territorial_description: The Gateway Alliance controls a substantial territory of 9 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Universities attracting scholars from all races
Complex legal systems balancing diverse needs

civilizations.name: Clockwork Burrow
civilizations.religious_beliefs: Honor the spirits of curiosity and invention
civilizations.cultural_description: Clockwork Burrow is a gnome civilization controlled by elite families. Their culture is defined by mastery of arcane arts, spirit of innovation and progress.

territory.territorial_description: Clockwork Burrow controls a substantial territory of 11 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

civilizations.name: Cosmopolitan Commonwealth
civilizations.cultural_description: Cosmopolitan Commonwealth is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization governed by elected councils. Their culture is defined by prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth, fierce independence and personal liberty, pursuit of knowledge and wisdom.

territory.territorial_description: Cosmopolitan Commonwealth controls a substantial territory of 11 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Universities attracting scholars from all races

civilizations.name: The Verdant Realm of Crystalvale
civilizations.cultural_description: The Verdant Realm of Crystalvale is a elf civilization ruled by hereditary monarchs. Their culture is defined by mastery of arcane arts, harmony with the natural world, pursuit of knowledge and wisdom.

territory.territorial_description: The Verdant Realm of Crystalvale controls a expansive territory of 16 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Masters of arcane arts and ancient lore
